meanings.definition: The quality or state of being tenacious.
meanings.sent1: Her tenacities in solving problems impressed her boss.
meanings.sent2: The tenacities of the glue kept the pieces together.
meanings.sent3: Despite its small size, the ant showed great tenacities in carrying the food.
meanings.sent4: His tenacities were like a strong magnet, never letting go of his goals.
meanings.sent5: The tenacities of the spider's web were evident in catching its prey.

meanings.definition: The quality of holding fast or sticking together.
meanings.sent1: The tenacities of the tape kept the box sealed.
meanings.sent2: The tenacities of the team ensured they stayed united during tough times.
meanings.sent3: The tenacities of the siblings made them inseparable.
meanings.sent4: The tenacities of the vines intertwined to form a strong bond.
meanings.sent5: The tenacities of the friendship were unbreakable.

meanings.definition: The quality of being persistent or stubborn.
meanings.sent1: His tenacities in negotiations often led to successful deals.
meanings.sent2: The tenacities of the child were evident in refusing to give up on the puzzle.
meanings.sent3: Despite the rain, the cat showed its tenacities in waiting for the mouse.
meanings.sent4: The tenacities of the old tree roots broke through the concrete.
meanings.sent5: Her tenacities in learning a new language paid off in the end.
